alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 7:01PM EDT until August 15 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Montgomery and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. An additional 0.5 to 1 inch of rain is possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Palmyra, Jenkintown, Rockledge, Wissinoming, Germantown, Tacony, Holmesburg, Chestnut Hill, Northeast Philadelphia, Wyncote, and Glenside. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 27 and 30. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 338 and 340. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
